properties.name: CAHEP / AuMHC Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Community Non-Profit Organization
properties.description: Aurora Mental Health Center (AuMHC) Behavioral Health Provider (BHP) offers exam room consultation, brief individual treatment, groups, and educational presentations to staff at the Colorado Alliance for Health Equity and Practice (CAHEP) clinic. This clinic primarily serves the needs of refugees, asylees, and immigrants to the community. The BHP also facilitates transfers to specialized mental health services.

properties.name: Hilltop Life Adjustment Program
properties.category: Collaboration with Community Non-Profit Organization
properties.description: Colorado West Regional Mental Health Center (CWRMHC) provides behavioral supportive management as a part of the Hilltop Life Adjustment Program, a community non-profit residential facility for traumatic brain injury (TBI) survivors. The facility has apartment living for up to 70 brain injured clients offering specialized adult day services. Psychiatry is provided on-site at set times for Hilltop residents needing services.

properties.name: Intermountain Nurse Family Partnership/WCMHC
properties.category: Collaboration with Community Non-Profit Organization
properties.description: West Central Mental Health Center (WCMHC) has a referral relationship with Intermountain Nurse Family Partnership, a community based non-profit organization. WCMHC provides behavioral healthcare services to patients referred and communicates treatment plans with nursing staff.

properties.name: Mesa Developmental Services/ CWRMHC Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Community Non-Profit Organization
properties.description: Mesa Developmental Services is a community non-profit organization that provides community-based services and supports for persons with developmental disabilities of Mesa County. Colorado West Regional Mental Health Center provides consultative support and direct services, including psychiatric services for a set number of hours per week, to those clients with co-occurring developmental disabilities and mental health needs.

properties.name: Pikes Peak Partnership
properties.category: Collaboration with Community Non-Profit Organization
properties.description: Pikes Peak Partnership (P3) is a family of agencies working together and sharing resources to serve people with mental, physical and cognitive disabilities. The affiliated agencies are the Multiple Sclerosis Alliance of Southern Colorado, AspenPointe Health Services, and Disability Services, Inc. AspenPointe Health Services co-locates a clinician to serve adults and youth with mental, physical and cognitive disabilities.

properties.name: Pioneer Health Care Center
properties.category: Collaboration with Community Non-Profit Organization
properties.description: This collaboration came about when the Pioneer Health Care Center, a local nursing home, began accepting clients from the forensics unit at the Colorado Mental Health Institute at Pueblo. SEMHS provides assessment, monitoring, evaluation and treatment and medication management for clients. SEMHS works as part of a treatment team which consists of the therapist, psychiatrist, case manager, nurse practitioner, primary care physician, and other health care providers to provide services on site.

properties.name: Rocky Mountain Youth Pediatrics / Aurora Mental Health Center Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Community Non-Profit Organization
properties.description: Aurora Mental Health Center (AuMHC) 0.5 FTE Behavioral Health Provider (BHP) offers exam room consultation, brief individual treatment, groups, and educational presentations to staff at the Rocky Mountain Youth - Aurora (RMY) clinic. The BHP also facilitates transfers to specialized mental health services.

properties.name: Silver Key Senior Services/ AspenPointe Health Services: Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Community Non-Profit Organization
properties.description: Sliver Key Senior Services, a community non-profit organization, provides a variety of services to help the elderly live safely and comfortably in their own homes. AspenPointe Health Services co-locates a clinician in this agency to serve older adults with mental health needs.

properties.name: Tri-County Health Care Program for Children with Special Needs (HCP)
properties.category: Collaboration with Community Non-Profit Organization

properties.name: Alamosa Family Medical Center: Valley Wide Health Systems and San Luis Valley Mental Health Center Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)

properties.name: Caesar E. Chavez Clinic: Valley Wide Health System and San Luis Valley Mental Health Center Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)

properties.name: Clinica Family Health Services, Inc. - People's Clinic / Mental Health Partners Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: The Mental Health Partners (MHP) embeds staff that is fully integrated and functioning as part of primary care teams at Clinica Family Health Services, Inc. - People's Clinic in Boulder, CO. Behavioral health clinicians function similarly to Clinica staff by following Clinica procedure's and charting responsibilities. This includes full-time bilingual clinicians as well as a psychiatrist who is at the clinic approximately 10 hours/week. The clinical approach is Solution Focused Brief Therapy, when appropriate.

properties.name: Clinica Family Health Services, Inc. ? Lafayette/Mental Health Partners Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: The Mental Health Partners (MHP) embeds staff that is fully integrated and functioning as part of primary care teams at Clinica Family Health Services, Inc. in Lafayette. Behavioral health clinicians function similarly to Clinica staff by following Clinica procedure's and charting responsibilities. This includes full-time bilingual clinicians as well as a psychiatrist who is at each clinic approximately 10 hours/week. The clinical approach is Solution Focused Brief Therapy, when appropriate.

properties.name: Connections for Kids Clinic (CFKC)
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: Denver Health created a specialty clinic located within Denver Health's Eastside Family Health Center, a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC), known as Connections for Kids Clinic (CFKC). CFKC integrates care in the medical home model to meet the needs of children in foster care in Denver County.  Two behavioral health clinicians, contracted from the Mental Health Center of Denver, screen patients for behavioral health needs.  Collaborating agencies include Denver Health, Denver Department of Human Services, Access Behavioral Care, Mental Health Center of Denver, and the Kempe Center for Abused and Neglected Children.

properties.name: Denver Health Eastside Family Health Center - Development of Integrated Behavioral Health Services (DIBS)
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: Denver Health created a specialty clinic located within Denver Health's Eastside Family Health Center, a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC), known as Connections for Kids Clinic (CFKC). CFKC integrates care in the medical home model to meet the needs of children in foster care in Denver County. Two behavioral health clinicians, contracted from the Mental Health Center of Denver, screen patients for behavioral health needs. Collaborating agencies include Denver Health, Denver Department of Human Services, Access Behavioral Care, Mental Health Center of Denver, and the Kempe Center for Abused and Neglected Children.

properties.name: Developmental Disabilities Health Center: Peak Vista Community Health Services and The Resource Exchange Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)

properties.name: Dove Creek Community Health Clinic/ Axis Health Systems Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: Located in Dove Creek, the Clinic serves Dolores County and is the smallest Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC) in the State. Axis Health System (formerly Southwest Colorado Mental Health Center) has contracted to make a Behavioral Health Consultant (BHC) available within the Clinic 20 hours per week as a member of the care team responding to the behavioral health concerns that emerge. The BHC sees patients, conducts evaluations, and when necessary offers crisis intervention. Psychiatric Consultation is also available.

properties.name: Edward M. Kennedy Clinic: Valley Wide Health Systems and San Luis Valley Mental Health Center Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)

properties.name: Family Health Center at Divide: Peak Vista Community Health Center and AspenPointe Health Services Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: Peak Vista Community Health Centers Family Health Center at Divide and AspenPointe Health Services co-locate at this clinic to provide integrative services. The model includes telephonic, psychiatric consultation for PCP providers. One Aspen Pointe clinician sees clients concurrently with the PCP (model is intended to be brief solution focused interventions). The Family Health Center at Divide is a rural based program of Peak Vista Community Health Centers, a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC).

properties.name: Family Health Center at Fountain: Peak Vista Community  Health Center and AspenPointe Health Services Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: Model includes psychiatric consultation for PCP providers. One AspenPointe Health Services clinician sees clients concurrently with the PCP (model is intended to be brief solution focused interventions). Peak Vista Community Health Centers are Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHC) and the Family Health Center at Fountain is a rural based program uniquely located in a health and wellness community center in a local high school.

properties.name: Family Health Center at Fountain: Peak Vista Community Health Center and AspenPointe Health Services Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: Peak Vista Community Health Centers, a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC), includes AspenPointe Health Services in its route for parking the children's healthcare van. AspenPointe Health Services advertises the availability of the van at its outpatient clinics.

properties.name: Family Health Center at Myron Stratton: Peak Vista Community Health Center and AspenPointe Health Services Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: Model includes psychiatric consultation for PCP providers. One AspenPointe Health Services clinician sees clients concurrently with the PCP (model is intended to be brief solution focused interventions). Peak Vista Community Health Centers ? Family Health Center at Myron Stratton is a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC) located in Colorado Springs.

properties.name: Family Health Center at Union: Peak Vista Community Health Center and AspenPointe Health Services Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: At this Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC), two AspenPointe Health Services clinicians see clients concurrently with the PCP (model is intended to be brief solution focused interventions). Two AspenPointe Health Services pre-doctoral interns open the clients (through "Track II") and work with the clients up to 10 sessions. Clients open to Track II may also work with the AspenPointe psychiatrist, who is on-site one half day per week.

properties.name: Fremont Family Medical Clinic and West Central Mental Health Center Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)

properties.name: Guadalupe Health Clinic
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)

properties.name: High Plains Community Health Center/Southeast Mental Health Services Co-location
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: High Plains Community Health Clinic is a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC) located in Lamar, CO. Southeast Mental Health Services (SEMHS) provides a full-time behavioral health therapist embedded on-site at the FQHC. The therapist works with the doctors and nurses providing coordinated care as a part of their treatment team to provide behavioral health assessments and direct clinical services, as well as referrals to other SEMHS treatment resources, when appropriate.

properties.name: Homeless Health Center: Peak Vista Community Health Center and AspenPointe Health Services Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: AspenPointe Health Services provides co-located care at Peak Vista Community Health Centers - Homeless Health Center utilizing a model that includes psychiatric consultation for Primary Care Providers (PCP) and direct psychiatric care. The Aspen Pointe clinician sees clients for individual sessions (may or may not be in conjunction with PCP). The Aspen Pointe psychiatrist is on site 4 hours per week for direct service and consultation to the Homeless Health Center's PCPs.

properties.name: MCPN Co-location - Arvada
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)

properties.name: MCPN Co-location - Lakewood
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)

properties.name: MCPN Co-location with JeffCo Action Center - Estes St. Clinic
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)

properties.name: Metro Community Provider Network - Potomac Street Health Center / Aurora Mental Health Center: Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: Aurora Mental Health Center (AuMHC) provides psychiatric consultations based on referrals from Metro Community Providers Network - Potomac Street Health Center (MCPN) medical providers for diagnosis clarification and medication recommendations. Psychiatric services provided an average of 4 hours per month.

properties.name: Metro Community Provider Network - South Aurora Family Health Services / Aurora Mental Health Center: Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: Aurora Mental Health Center (AuMHC) Behavioral Health Providers (BHP) offer exam room consultation, brief individual treatment, groups and educational presentations to staff at Metro Community Providers Network South Aurora Family Services; Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC). The BHP also facilitates transfers to specialized mental health services.

properties.name: Moreno Health Center: Peak Vista Community Health Center and AspenPointe Health Services Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)

properties.name: Mountain Family Health Center
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)

properties.name: North Range Behavioral Health Integrated Behavioral Health Project - Sunrise Community Health, Inc / North Range Behavioral Health: Fully Integrated Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: North Range Behavioral Health (NRBH) is integrating behavioral health staff with Sunrise Community Health, Inc. staff at each respective office, including the Monfort Children's Clinic, Kid's Care Clinic, and the Monfort Family Clinic. The services are already integrated at at all locations. Staff members first must complete training on integrated service delivery before employment. NRBH will begin providing on-site psychiatric services at Sunrise locations in Spring 2010. Sunrise Community Health, Inc. will open a primary care clinic within NRBH by Summer 2010.

properties.name: Northwest Colorado Community Health Center / Colorado West Regional Mental Health Center: Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: Colorado West Regional Mental Health Center (CWRMHC) clinicians (behavioral health specialists) are available at the primary care Northwest Colorado Community Health Center (NCCHC), a Federally Qualified Health Cener, and may be called in to consult with any patient receiving medical services. NCCHC is a part of the Northwest Colorado Visiting Nurses Association. If a specific behavioral issue is identified, the patient may return to meet with one of the clinicians up to 4 times. If a more severe mental health issue and/or need for medication are identified, patient is referred to Colorado West Regional Mental Health Center(Craig Mental Health) for services and opened as a regular client.

properties.name: PATH Program: Spanish Peaks Mental Health Center / Posada / Pueblo Community Health Center, Inc.
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: The PATH program employs two full-time, Masters-level Licensed Clinical Social Workers from Spanish Peaks Mental Health Center. These clinicians interface with Posada, an agency providing housing and supportive services that empower homeless individuals and families in Pueblo County, and work with physical health providers from the Pueblo Community Health Center, Inc.,  a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC) to provide integrated care.

properties.name: Salud Family Health Centers - Fort Morgan Clinic / Centennial Mental Health Center: Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: Centennial Mental Health Center's (CMHC) psychiatric staff contract with Salud Family Health Centers - Fort Morgan Clinic, a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC), to provide direct service for 4 hours per week on site at the Salud Fort Morgan Clinic. Centennial also contracts for an additional 4 hours each week to provide consultation with medical staff at the Fort Morgan Clinic.

properties.name: Salud Family Health Centers ? Estes Park Clinic / Larimer Center for Mental Health: Co-Location
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: Larimer Center for Mental Health (LCMH) embeds a part time staff that is fully integrated and functioning as part of the primary care team at Salud Family Health Centers - Estes Park Clinic, the Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC) in rural Estes Park, Colorado. Additionally, the LCMH office is co-located in the Estes Park Clinic. LCMH provides mental health and substance abuse treatment to residents of Larimer County.

properties.name: Salud Family Health Centers ? Longmont Clinic/ Mental Health Parnters: Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: The Mental Health Partners (MHP) embeds staff that is fully integrated and functioning as part of primary care teams at Salud Family Health Centers - Longmont Clinic. Behavioral health clinicians function similarly to Salud staff by following Salud's procedures, and chart responsibilities. This includes full-time bilingual clinicians as well as a psychiatrist on site for 10 hours/week. The clinical approach is Solution-Focused Brief Therapy, when appropriate.

properties.name: San Luis Health Center: Valley Wide Health System and San Luis Valley Mental Health Center Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)

properties.name: Sierra Blanca Health Clinic: Valley Wide Health System and San Luis Valley Mental Health Center Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)

properties.name: Sunrise Community Health, Inc. - Loveland / Loveland Counseling Connections - Larimer Center for Mental Health: Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: Loveland Counseling Connections (LCC) is a program of Larimer Center for Mental Health (LCMH) which provides information and referral services, crisis intervention, and brief counseling to residents of southern Larimer County who are seeking mental health services. LCC is co-located with Sunrise Community Health, Inc., the local Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC).

properties.name: Uncompahgre Medical Center / Midwestern Colorado Mental Health Center dba The Center for Mental Health: Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: Midwestern Colorado Mental Health Center DBA The Center for Mental Health contracts with Uncompahgre Medical Center (UMC), a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC), to provide 32 hours per month of mental health treatment services at the FQHC. These services include therapy, psychiatric evaluations and medications management. Midwestern Colorado Mental Health Center also has a psychiatrist available on an ongoing basis for consultation to UMC.

properties.name: Valley Wide Health Systems, Inc. / San Luis Valley Comprehensive Community Mental Health Center: Co-Location
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: Valley Wide Health Systems, Inc. (VWHS), a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC) has staff from the San Luis Valley Mental Health Center (SLVMHC) co-located at this site to provide Screening, Brief Intervention, Referral and Treatment (SBIRT) type services for clients with mental health and/or substance abuse treatment needs. Mental health treatment services may be provided on-site based on decision by clinician, facility and client of where to best serve the client's needs.

properties.name: Valley-Wide Health Systems, Inc. / Southeast Mental Health Services: Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC)
properties.description: Valley-Wide Health Systems, Inc. (VWHS), a community/migrant Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC), provides comprehensive health care services with special consideration for medically underserved populations. Southeast Mental Health Services (SEMHS) provides a therapist on site at the Rocky Ford Clinic 2 days a week providing referral and direct services for clients with mental health and substance abuse treatment needs.

properties.name: Leadville Medical Center and West Central Mental Health Center Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Hospital or Hospital Clinic designated as a Rural Health Clinic (RHC)

properties.name: Pagosa Springs Medical Center Rural Health Clinic
properties.category: Collaboration with Hospital or Hospital Clinic designated as a Rural Health Clinic (RHC)

properties.name: Rio Grande Hospital Clinic and San Luis Valley Mental Health Center Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Hospital or Hospital Clinic designated as a Rural Health Clinic (RHC)
properties.description: San Luis Valley Mental Health Center (SLVMHC) has offices at the same facility as the Rio Grande Hospital Clinic, a Rural Health Clinic (RHC), in Del Norte, CO. The two organizations collaborate through a referral based relationship. SLVMHC provides ongoing mental health treatment services to patients referred from the Hospital Clinic.

properties.name: Rocky Mountain Family Practice and West Central Mental Health Center Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Hospital or Hospital Clinic designated as a Rural Health Clinic (RHC)

properties.name: Southwest Memorial Primary Care/ Axis Health Systems Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Hospital or Hospital Clinic designated as a Rural Health Clinic (RHC)
properties.description: Southwest Memorial Primary Care Clinic in Cortez serves Montezuma County and surrounding areas. The clinic is designated as a Rural Health Clinic (RHC) by HRSA. Axis Health System (formerly Southwest Colorado Mental Health Center) makes a Behavioral Health Consultant (BHC) available in the Clinic on a regular schedule (20 hours per week) to assist with the behavioral health concerns of patients and families.

properties.name: Telluride Medical Center/ The Center for Mental Health Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Hospital or Hospital Clinic designated as a Rural Health Clinic (RHC)
properties.description: Telluride Medical Center (TMC) provides space in their clinic for a Midwestern Colorado Mental Health Center (MWMHC) psychiatrist to provide psychiatric evaluations and medication management services to residents of Telluride and surrounding communities. Coordination of care of mutual clients and psychiatric consultation to medical staff are also provided.

properties.name: Tri-County Health Department Prenatal Plus Program
properties.category: Collaboration with Local Health Department or Social Services
properties.description: Community Reach Center, the Community Mental Health Center (CMHC) in Adams County, provides a .5 therapist that is co-located at the Tri-County Health Department Prenatal Plus Program. This therapist provides assessment, therapy and referral services on-site.

properties.name: Clinica Tepeyac - Asian Pacific Development Center Integrated Care Services
properties.category: Collaboration with Non-profit Clinic or Hospital Clinic designated as a Community Funded Safety Net Clinic (CSNC)
properties.description: This Community Funded Safety Net Clinic (CSNC) provides integrated healthcare to medically underserved clients in the Denver-metro area. Asian Pacific Development Center provides co-located behavioral health clinical staff and case managers at the clinic that work collaboratively with primary care providers to create a medical home for clients.

properties.name: Marillac Clinic/ CWRMHC Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Non-profit Clinic or Hospital Clinic designated as a Community Funded Safety Net Clinic (CSNC)
properties.description: The Marillac Medical Clinic is a Community Funded Safety Net Clinic (CSNC) that serves the Mesa County uninsured population, offering primary care and mental health services through a co-located collaboration with Colorado West Regional Mental Health Center (CWRMHC). The clinic provides comprehensive mental healthcare through medications management, mental health screening and treatment, joint primary and mental health care appointments, as well as group and individual therapy.

properties.name: Physician Services and San Luis Valley Mental Health Center Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Non-profit Clinic or Hospital Clinic designated as a Community Funded Safety Net Clinic (CSNC)

properties.name: St. Mary's Family Medicine/ Colorado West Regional MHC Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Non-profit Clinic or Hospital Clinic designated as a Community Funded Safety Net Clinic (CSNC)
properties.description: Colorado West Regional Mental Health Center (CWRMHC) and the St. Mary's Family Medicine Center, a Community Funded Safety Net Clinic (CSNC), collaborate to lead teaching clinics that provide low cost mental health services at this primary care family medicine site.

properties.name: Summit Community Care Clinic/ Colorado West MHC Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Non-profit Clinic or Hospital Clinic designated as a Community Funded Safety Net Clinic (CSNC)
properties.description: Colorado West Regional Mental Health Center (CWRMHC) has full time behavioral health providers embedded at the Summit Community Care Clinic, a Community Funded Safety Net Clinic (CSNC) in Frisco. Every patient seen at the clinic is screened for mental health and substance abuse issues and connected with a behavioral health provider as necessary.

properties.name: The Children's Hospital -Outpatient Health Clinics/ Aurora MHC Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Non-profit Clinic or Hospital Clinic designated as a Community Funded Safety Net Clinic (CSNC)
properties.description: The Children's Hospital (TCH) Outpatient Health Clinics, Community Funded Safety Net Clinics (CSNCs), host Aurora Mental Health Center (AuMHC) Behavioral Health Providers (BHP) that offer exam room consultation, brief individual treatment, groups and educational presentations to staff. BHP also facilitates transfers to specialized mental health services.

properties.name: Advanced Pediatric Associates
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice
properties.description: Aurora Mental Health Center (AuMHC) Behavioral Health Provider (BHP) offers exam room consultation, brief individual treatment and family therapy, groups, and educational presentations to staff at this private pediatric clinic in Aurora. The BHP also facilitates transfers to specialized mental health services.

properties.name: Arapahoe Park Pediatrics/ADMHN Co-Location
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice
properties.description: Arapahoe/Douglas Mental Health Network (ADMHN) co-locates a therapist at Arapahoe Park Pediatrics for 14 hours per week. This therapist does initial assessments and therapy on-site in the primary care office. Referrals are made to the mental health center and other resources are given, if appropriate.

properties.name: Belmar Family Medicine
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: Conifer Mountain Family Medicine
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: Custer County Medical Clinic (Rural Health Clinic) /WCMHC Integration
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice
properties.description: West Central Mental Health Center (WCMHC) is co-located at the Custer County Medical Clinic, designated a Rural Health Center (RHC) by HRSA, providing assessments, consultation and referrals, as well as some direct clinical services. A Mental Health Clinician is co-located at the clinic eight hours on Fridays.

properties.name: Doctor's Care Primary Care and Arapahoe/Douglas Mental Health Network Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: Dr. Charles B. Johnson III, MD (Family Practice)/ PPBHG Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice
properties.description: AspenPointe Health services co-locates a clinician 4.5 days per week in Dr. Charles Johnson's family practice office to serve adults and youth with a possible behavioral health diagnosis in a brief, solution-focused manner.

properties.name: Dr. Lisa Zwerdlinger: Rocky Mountain Family Practice and West Central Mental Health Center Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: Family Care Southwest
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: First Street Family Medicine and West Central Mental Health Center Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: Fleishaker and Kreuter Pediatrics
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: Lakewood Family Medicine
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: Lone Tree Family Practice / ADMHN Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice
properties.description: Arapahoe/Douglas Mental Health Network (ADMHN) provides individual, couple, and family therapuetic services to clients at Lone Tree Family Practice. A Licensed Professional Counselor is co-located at the practice for 8 hours each week.

properties.name: Meadows Family Medical Center (Rural Health Clinic) Idaho Springs
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice
properties.description: Jefferson Center for Mental Health (Jefferson Center) and the Meadows Family Medical Center (MFMC) have a referral and consultative relationship at the Meadows Family Clinic, a Rural Health Clinic (RHC) in Idaho Springs, CO.

properties.name: Mountainland Pediatrics, Inc.
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice
properties.description: Community Reach Center (CRC) has co-located a group pediatric practice with its Early Childhood Team at this site, including an occupational therapist. Beginning in 2010, psychiatry consultation is now available for the medical providers. Community Reach Center owns the building and operates both practices.

properties.name: North Park Medical Center (Rural Health Clinic)/ CWRMHC Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice
properties.description: North Park Medical Center, a Rural Health Clinic (RHC) and Colorado West Regional Mental Health Center (CWRMHC) are co-located at this private primary care site. North Park practitioners assist mental health clients with treatment prior to visits with Psychiatrist, assist with emergent clients if needed, and dispense medication samples when necessary. A mental health professional joins in visit with patient for an assessment when symptoms of a mental health diagnosis are observed by the primary care practitioner.

properties.name: Peak Pediatrics
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: Pediatric Medical Home (Fleischaker and Kreuter Pediatrics and Jefferson Center for Mental Health)
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice
properties.description: Jefferson Center for Mental Health (Jefferson Center) provides psychiatric and clinical consultation on-site at Peak Pediatrics approximately once every 2 months. Consultation and referral are provided off site at Rocky Mountain Pediatrics and Fleishaker and Kreuter Pediatric practices due to space limitations.

properties.name: Pediatric Partners of the Southwest
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice
properties.description: Axis Health System provides a Behavioral Health Provider (BHP) on-site two days a week at Pediatric Partners, a private pediatric practice located in Durango, CO. This BHP is an early childhood specialist who engages in screening, parental guidance, brief intervention to children and families, consultation to medical staff and referral for additional services. Pediatric Partners is located is the largest practice in La Plata county.

properties.name: Pediatric Practice Medical Home (Peak Pediatrics and Jefferson Center for Mental Health)
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice
properties.description: Jefferson Center for Mental Health (Jefferson Center) provides psychiatric and clinical consultation on-site at Peak Pediatrics approximately once every 2 months. Consultation and referral are provided off site at Rocky Mountain Pediatrics and Fleishaker and Kreuter Pediatric practices due to space limitations.

properties.name: Pediatric Practice Medical Home (Rocky Mountain Pediatrics and Jefferson Center for Mental Health)
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice
properties.description: Jefferson Center for Mental Health (Jefferson Center) provides psychiatric and clinical consultation on-site at Peak Pediatrics approximately once every 2 months. Consultation and referral are provided off site at Rocky Mountain Pediatrics and Fleishaker and Kreuter Pediatric practices due to space limitations.

properties.name: Rocky Mountain Pediatrics
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: Rocky Mountain Primary Care - Arvada
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: Rocky Mountain Primary Care - Lakewood
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: Rocky Mountain Primary Care - Westminster
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: Salida Family Medicine and West Central Mental Health Center Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: Senior Reach at Boulder Senior Medical Center
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: Senior Reach at Wheat Ridge Internal Medicine
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: South Park Internal Medicine and Arapahoe/Douglas Mental Health Network Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: St. Thomas More Physicians Group and West Central Mental Health Center Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice

properties.name: Wheat Ridge Internal Medicine/ Jefferson Center for Mental Health Collaboration
properties.category: Collaboration with Private Primary Care Practice
properties.description: At Wheat Ridge Internal Medicine (WRIM), Jefferson Center for Mental Health (Jefferson Center) provides regular on-site behavioral health services from behavioral health professionals. Behavioral health services include assessment, depression screening, focused interventions and consultation. Senior peer counseling is also provided to patients as indicated. Eight (8) hours per week of behavioral health professional time provided on-site.

properties.name: Be Well Clinic at Arapahoe/Douglas Mental Health Network
properties.category: Primary Care Services collaboration at a Community Mental Health Center
properties.description: Medical Services are provided by a full-time Nurse Practicioner and .5 FTE Medical Assistant to clients of Arapahoe/Douglas Mental Health Network (ADMHN) a Community Mental Health Center (CMHC), at their outpatient facility and Acute Treatment Unit (ATU). Physical health services are also provided as wellness programs for ADMHN clients.

properties.name: Chambers Clinic: Aurora Mental Health Center and Metro Community Providers Network Collaboration
properties.category: Primary Care Services collaboration at a Community Mental Health Center

properties.name: Colorado Wellness Center for Refugees and Immigrants
properties.category: Primary Care Services collaboration at a Community Mental Health Center

properties.name: Cortez Integrated Healthcare
properties.category: Primary Care Services collaboration at a Community Mental Health Center

properties.name: Health Care Homes Without Walls - Colfax
properties.category: Primary Care Services collaboration at a Community Mental Health Center

properties.name: Health Care Homes Without Walls - Independence
properties.category: Primary Care Services collaboration at a Community Mental Health Center

properties.name: Integrating Primary Care and Wellness - MHCD/DHMC
properties.category: Primary Care Services collaboration at a Community Mental Health Center
properties.description: IPCW is a 4-year project funded by the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) to integrate primary care into a single Mental Health Center of Denver (MHCD) clinical site. In conjunction with Denver Health Medical Center (DHMC), it locates a full time adult nurse practitioner at the clinic. MHCD consumers participate primarily through the Colorado Indigent Care Program (CICP).

properties.name: Karen's House - Assisted Living Facility
properties.category: Primary Care Services collaboration at a Community Mental Health Center

properties.name: PRICARe: Promoting Resources for Integrated Care and Recovery
properties.category: Primary Care Services collaboration at a Community Mental Health Center
properties.description: PRICARe is a 3-year, Colorado Health Foundation grant-funded project awarded to Colorado Access to integrate primary care into two Mental Health Center of Denver (MHCD) clinical sites. In conjunction with Colorado Access and the University of Colorado ? Denver (UCD) Department of Family Medicine, program locates a full time Family Practice MD and currently offers primary care to MHCD consumers covered by Medicare, Colorado Access Advantage, Medicaid or private insurance.

properties.name: Sunrise North Range Clinic
properties.category: Primary Care Services collaboration at a Community Mental Health Center
properties.description: Integrated Care at CMHC - Sunrise Community Health Center, a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC), operates a full primary care clinic within North Range Behavioral Health (NRBH), a Community Mental Health Center in Greeley. In addition to providing primary care services, staff screens for behavioral health needs and coordinates care with NRBH accordingly. The site would like to open an on-site pharmacy in the future to improve its integrated care efforts.

properties.name: Union Square Health Home
properties.category: Primary Care Services collaboration at a Community Mental Health Center

properties.name: Abraham Lincoln High School - School-Based Health Center
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: Through partnerships with Denver Public Schools, Denver Health, and Arapahoe House, the Mental Health Center of Denver (MHCD) has integrated mental health therapists into the health facility at Lincoln High.

properties.name: Adams City High School - School Based Health Center
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: This school-based health clinic (SBHC) located at Adams City High School is a collaborative effort between the Adams County School District, Community Reach Center (CRC) and Community Health Services. The SBHC is housed in the school building, follows the school calendar, and is know as The Wellness Center. Psychiatry services are available to adolescents seen as part of the integrated care model of treatment.

properties.name: Alameda High School - MCPN School-based Health Center
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)

properties.name: Centennial High School - School Based Health
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: Spanish Peaks Mental Health Center (SPMHC) provides licensed clinicians at the school Wellness Center. Services offered at the Wellness Center include Individual, group and family therapy. Case management services include phone support, collaboration and consultation with Pueblo School District 60, Pueblo city and Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment, SPMHC, PCS, Pueblo Police Department, 10th Judicial District, Crossroads Turning Point, Pueblo District Attorney and Parkview hospital.

properties.name: Colorado's Finest - School-Based Health Clinic
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)

properties.name: Cripple Creek/ Victor Mountain School-Based Health Center
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: The Cripple Creek-Victor Mountain Health Center (CCV MHC) school-based health center is located at Cresson Elementary in the school nurse's office. This important initiative is in partnership with Peak Vista Community Health Centers, the Cripple Creek-Victor School District, Cripple Creek Counseling Center and AspenPointe Health Services. AspenPointe Health Services co-locates a child and family clinician to treat the mental health needs of the school districts' children. Referrals are received from teachers, school-based nurse and counselors.

properties.name: Durango High School (School Based Health Center)
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: Axis Health System (formerly Southwest Colorado Mental Health Center) has worked to make behavioral health services available in the School Based Health Center operating within Durango High School working as a Behavioral Health Consultant (BHC). An Axis clinician is available 32-hours per week as a member of the Center's care team. The BHC assists students with issues related to depression, substance use, and family issues. A child and adolescent psychiatrist is available for consultation with staff at regular times.

properties.name: Englewood School-Based Health Clinic
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: Arapahoe/Douglas Mental Health Network (ADMHN) provides an MA level licensed therapist located in the Englewood Schools Health Clinic. This therapist provides assessment, brief intervention, triage and referral on site for 40 hours per week. Other stakeholders include Swedish Family Medicine Residency Program and the Englewood School District.

properties.name: Entrada School Based Health Center
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: Entrada School-Based Health Center, located at Carmel Middle School in Colorado Springs, serves students attending all Harrison School District 2 school's students and their siblings up to 21 years of age. AspenPointe Health Services co-locates a child and family clinician to treat the mental health needs of the school districts' children. Referrals to mental health are received from teachers, school-based nurse and counselors.

properties.name: Florida Mesa Elementary School - School Based Health Center
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: Axis Health System (formerly Southwest Colorado Mental Health Center) staff members have been involved in the planning of a new SBHC that will operate at Florida Mesa Elementary School, a rural elementary school located in District 9-R. The SBHC will use a model similar to the Durango High School Clinic, making a Behavioral Health Consultant available on each week. Axis will begin serving as the Medical Sponsor for both 9-R Clinics.

properties.name: Freed Middle School Wellness Center
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: Spanish Peaks Mental Health Center (SPMHC) provides licensed clinicians at the school Wellness Center. Services offered at the Wellness Center include Individual, group and family therapy. Case management services include phone support, collaboration and consultation with Pueblo School District 60, Pueblo city and Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment, SPMHC, PCS, Pueblo Police Department, 10th Judicial District, Crossroads Turning Point, Pueblo District Attorney and Parkview hospital.

properties.name: Jefferson High School - MCPN School-based Health Center
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)

properties.name: John F Kennedy High School - School-Based Health Center
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: Through partnerships with Denver Public Schools, Denver Health, and Arapahoe House, the Mental Health Center of Denver (MHCD) has integrated mental health therapists into the health facility at Kennedy High.

properties.name: Kearney Middle School - School Based Health Center
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: This school-based health clinic (SBHC) located at Kearney Middle School is a collaborative effort between the Adams County School District, Community Reach Center (CRC) and Community Health Services. The SBHC is open year-round to the community. Psychiatry services are available to adolescents seen as part of the integrated care model of treatment.

properties.name: Lamar High School (School Based Clinic)
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: Lamar High School houses this School Based Health Center (SBHC) offering integrated healthcare. Southeast Mental Health Services (SEMHS) provides a full-time therapist on-site working as a part of a treatment team made up of school nurse and doctors from High Plains Community Health Center, a local Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC).

properties.name: Martin Luther King Early College - School-Based Health Center
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: Through partnerships with Denver Public Schools, Denver Health, and Arapahoe House, the Mental Health Center of Denver (MHCD) has integrated mental health therapists into the health facility at MLK Early College.

properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: Through partnerships with Denver Public Schools, Denver Health, and Arapahoe House, the Mental Health Center of Denver (MHCD) has integrated mental health therapists into the health facility at Montbello High

properties.description: Through partnerships with Denver Public Schools, Denver Health, and Arapahoe House, the Mental Health Center of Denver (MHCD) has integrated mental health therapists into the health facility at Noel Middle School.

properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: Through partnerships with Denver Public Schools, Denver Health, and Arapahoe House, the Mental Health Center of Denver (MHCD) has integrated mental health therapists into the health facility at North High.

properties.name: Northside Elementary ? School Based Health Center
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: This free-standing school-based health center is located on the Northside Elementary School grounds. Midwestern Colorado Mental Health Center (MWMHC) has a therapist on-site full-time to provide mental health consultations, referrals and direct clinical services to the students and families of the Montrose RE-1J School District. The mental health therapist works closely with the full-time physician's assistant and outreach staff to receive, warm handoff referrals, and to coordinate needed care of mutual clients. Spanish-speaking staff on site.

properties.name: Olathe Elementary School - School Based Health Center
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: Primary care, mental health, migrant farmworker and outreach services are offered to residents of Olathe and surrounding communities. Midwestern Colorado Mental Health Center (MWMHC)has two therapists located on site to provide mental health services to students in the Olathe school system and to all others referred by the medical providers in the clinic and those who are self-referred. Referrals are also made to and received from on-site migrant farmworker and outreach staff. Spanish-speaking staff on site.

properties.name: Pitts Middle School - School Based Health
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: Spanish Peaks Mental Health Center (SPMHC) provides licensed clinicians at the school Wellness Center. Services offered at the Wellness Center include Individual, group and family therapy. Case management services include phone support, collaboration and consultation with Pueblo School District 60, Pueblo city and Colorado Department of Public Health andEnvironment, SPMHC, PCS, Pueblo Police Department, 10th Judicial District, Crossroads Turning Point, Pueblo District Attorney and Parkview hospital.

properties.name: Sheridan Schools Health Clinic
properties.category: School Based Health Center (SBHC)
properties.description: Arapahoe/Douglas Mental Health Network (ADMHN) provides a psychiatrist that is located in the Sheridan Schools Health Clinic providing psychiatric medication management on site for 4 hours per month. Stakeholders include the Sheridan Health Clinic and the Sheridan School District.
